member.name: T:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler
member.summary:
Handler for basic Oracle database operations using Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client for .NET Framework 4.0.
Higher .NET Framework version is NOT supported.

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.ExecuteScript(Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleConnection,System.String)
member.summary:
To execute SQL script using non-query execution. Useful for non-query and non-data insertion (UPDATE and DELETE).
This method does not open or close database connection. The connection must already be opened for the method to work.
member.param: the already opened database connection.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
member.returns: number of rows affected.

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.ExecuteScript(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: To execute SQL script using non-query execution. Useful for non-query and non-data insertion (UPDATE and DELETE).
member.param: the string used to establish connection with the database.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
member.returns: number of rows affected.

To execute SQL script using non-query execution. Useful for non-query and non-data insertion (UPDATE and DELETE).

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.ExecuteSpecialScript(Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleConnection,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object})
member.summary:
To execute SQL script using non-query execution. Useful for non-query and non-data insertion (UPDATE and DELETE). The parameters in the [script] must be specially named @par1, @par2, @par3, and so on in accordance with the list of object ([parValues]) assigned
This method does not open or close database connection. The connection must already be opened for the method to work.
member.param: the already opened database connection.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
the list of objects containing values of specially named parameters in the [script]
member.returns: number of rows affected.

member.param: the string used to establish connection with the database.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
the list of objects containing values of specially named parameters in the [script]
member.returns: number of rows affected.

member.summary:

This method does not open or close database connection. The connection must already be opened for the method to work.
member.param: the already opened database connection.
the script to be executed that returns DataTable
the list of objects containing values of specially named parameters in the [script]
member.returns: The DataTable result of the executed script

the script to be executed using non-query execution.

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.ExecuteProcedureOrFunction(Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleConnection,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleParameter},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
To execute a Stored Procedure or a Function using non-query execution.
This method does not open or close database connection. The connection must already be opened for the method to work.
member.param: the already opened database connection.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
list of SQL parameters.

Oracle Only: to set/unset OracleCommand.BindByName property. If the property is not set, the sequence of return and parameters of the function/procedure must be strictly followed by OracleParameter(s) in the [pars] (ReturnValue must be put as the first parameter in [pars] for function calling). BindByName might slow down the execution process.
member.returns: generated integer.

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.ExecuteProcedureOrFunction(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Oracle.ManagedDataAccess.Client.OracleParameter},System.Boolean)
member.summary: To execute a Stored Procedure or a Function using non-query execution.
member.param: the string used to establish connection with the database.
the script to be executed using non-query execution.
list of SQL parameters.

Oracle Only: to set/unset OracleCommand.BindByName property. If the property is not set, the sequence of return and parameters of the function/procedure must be strictly followed by OracleParameter(s) in the [pars] (ReturnValue must be put as the first parameter in [pars] for function calling). BindByName might slow down the execution process.
member.returns: generated integer.

member.summary:
To transfer the data from one table to another by using C# classes' instances as intermediary objects. The tables must be located in the same database.
This method does not open or close database connection. The connection must already be opened for the method to work.
member.typeparam: the generic data type to represent the source table.
the generic data type to represent the destination table.
member.param: the already opened database connection.
the name of the source table of the transfer.
the name of the destination table of the transfer.
the source to destination class properties' name mapping (from TSource to TDest).
the names of the properties of source class whose values are NOT transferred to the destination class' instance.
the names of the properties of the destination class whose values are NOT transferred to the destination database row entry (likely is the Id of the entry).
the single (default) custom DateTimeFormat to be used in inserting the DateTime columns to the destination database.
the column-by-column map of custom DateTimeFormats to be used in inserting the DateTime columns to the destination database.
Oracle Only: to list which columns are TIMESTAMP in the destination table
member.returns: results of scalar execution of the INSERT INTO script.

member.name: M:Extension.Database.Oracle.OracleHandler.HasEquivalentDataType(System.String)

To check if equivalent .NET data type could be obtained from Oracle's data-type string
